text: The Casa Agostini, in Yauco, Puerto Rico, is a Classical Revival house designed by Miguel Briganti Pinti. It was built in the early 1800s and was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1988. It is a two-story stuccoed masonry commercial and residential building that is L-shaped in plan. Its main facade has eight bays. With . It served as a coffee warehouse and processing plant, as well as a residence and was built for Corsican immigrant Jose Maria Agostini Santini. ==References== Category:National Register of Historic Places in Puerto Rico Category:Classical Revival architecture in Puerto Rico
title: Casa Agostini
